title: [Health] A new study shows there is a clear link between vitamin D deficiency and oxidative capacity in skeletal muscle. Lacking sufficient levels of vitamin D in the bloodstream may negatively affect muscle function, particularly in older adults, due to a reduction in energy production.

[Neuroscience] Scientists show that even small amounts of the plasticisers bisphenol A and bisphenol S disrupt the transmission of signals between nerve cells in the brains of fish. The researchers consider it very likely that similar interference can also occur in the brains of adult humans
